title: Parent Trap star Elaine Hendrix lands part in Dynasty season 3
text:
We can’t wait to see her in this! (Picture: Disney)

You may remember her from the remake of The Parent Trap with Lindsay Lohan – but actress Elaine Hendrix will be back on our screens for season three of Dynasty.

She played the wannabe stepmother in the 1998 film where she tried to terrorise Lindsay Lohan (or it could have been the other way round).

Elaine, who co-starred alongside Elizabeth Gillies in FX’s Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll, will be playing the character of Alexis Carrington in the new season.

The 48-year-old will be the third actress to play the role in the Dynasty reboot.

She will replace Nicollette Sheridan, who started playing Alexis when the show started in 2017 – however, she left in March this year so that she could take care of her terminally-ill mother.

Nicollette Sheridan, Grant Show, Ana Brenda Contreras, and Elizabeth Gillies in Dynasty (Picture: CBS)

According to the network, ‘Alexis is back in Atlanta, with a new look, a new man, and plenty of scores to settle’ in season three, though an exact date for the character’s return is not yet known.

Fellow actress Elizabeth has also tweeted about how excited she is to have her pal work alongside her again.

She posted: ‘Words can’t express how excited I am about our new Alexis!! Beyond thrilled to be back on set with @elaine4animals. Can’t think of anyone better to fill this role. We’re getting the band back together, Elaine!’

Elaine then replied: ‘Love you @LizGillies! So happy to be together again. This is gonna be goooood.’

Elaine is not only well-known for her role in The Parent Trap, but she is also famous for Inspector Gadget 2 and you may remember her starring alongside Lisa Kudrow in Romy and Michele’s High School Reunion.

Her television career also saw her star in sitcom Friends, Charmed and CSI.

Netflix plans to launch Season 3 of Dynasty in the Summer of 2020.
